intro: Paepalanthus elatissimus, commonly known as the giant arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a starchy, edible tuberous root that is used in traditional cuisine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and a valuable agricultural resource.
